name: core/eventlisteners.js
eventListenerModule

params.name: canvasElement
params.description: The canvas element we listen events from. Will try to search the first canvas in the DOM, if none is provided

name: core/Map.js
Map
description:
Main class for the whole engine, which initializes the whole structure and plugins

You use the class by instantiating it with new and then initialize with init-method:
var map = new Map(canvasElement, mapOptions );
promises = map.init( gameData.pluginsToActivate, mapData.startPoint );

Plugins can be added with activatePlugins-method by prodiving init(map) method in the plugin. Plugins are always
functions, not objects that are instantiated. Plugins are supposed to extend the map object or anything in it via
it's public methods.

unknown.tagValue:
Plugins that use eventlistener by default, use pointer events polyfill, such as: https://github.com/jquery/PEP
Plugins and eventlistener can be overriden, but they user pointer events by default (either the browser must support
them or use polyfill)

params.name: canvasContainer
params.description: HTML element which will be container for the created canvas element

params.name: props
params.description: Extra properties

params.name: props.startCoord
params.description: Coordinates where the map starts at

params.name: props.bounds
params.description: Bounds of the map / mapSize

params.name: props.rendererOptions
params.description: Renderer options passed to PIXI.autoDetectRenderer

params.name: props.subContainers
params.description: Subcontainers size in pixels. If given, will activate subcontainers. If not given or false, subcontainers are not used.area.

types: function(FPS: Number, FPStime: Number, renderTime: Number, drawCount: Number): void
params.name: trackFPSCB
params.description: Callback function for tracking FPS in renderer. So this is used for debugging and optimizing.

name: canvas
description: canvas element that was generated and is being used by this new generated Map instance.

name: plugins
description: list of plugins that the map uses and are initialized

name: subContainersConfig
description: Subcontainers size that we want to generate, when layers use subcontainers

name: trackFPSCB
description: Callback function that gets the current FPS on the map and shows it in DOM

name: objectManager
description: ObjectManager instance. Responsible for retrieving the objects from the map, on desired occasions. Like when the player clicks the map to select some object.

name: init
description: initialization method

params.name: plugins
params.description:
Plugins to be activated for the map. Normally you should give the plugins here
instead of separately passing them to activatePlugins method. You can provide the module strings or module objects.

params.name: coord
params.description: Starting coordinates for the map

params.name: tickCB
params.description: callback function for tick. Tick callback is initiated in every frame. So map draws happen during ticks

params.name: options
params.description: Fullsize: Do we set fullsize canvas or not.

return.description: Returns an array of Promises. If this is empty / zero. Then there is nothing to wait for, if it contains promises, you have to wait for them to finish for the plugins to work and map be ready.

name: whenReady
description: The correct way to update / redraw the map. Check happens at every tick and thus in every frame.

name: drawOnNextTick
description: The correct way to update / redraw the map. Check happens at every tick and thus in every frame.

name: getLayersWithAttributes
description: The correct way to update / redraw the map. Check happens at every tick and thus in every frame.

name: addLayer
description: All parameters are passed to Map_layer constructor

name: usesSubContainers
description: Does the map use subContainers

name: getViewportArea
description: Get the size of area that is shown to the player. Depends a bit if we want to show the maximum possible or current.

params.name: isLocal
params.description: Do we want to use moving layer or static (global) coordinates

return.description: x- and y-coordinates and the width and height of the viewport

params.name: layer
params.description: the layer object to be removed

return.description: layer with the passed layer name

name: moveMap
description: Moves the map the amount of given x and y pixels. Note that this is not the destination coordinate, but the amount of movement that the map should move. Internally it moves the movableLayer, taking into account necessary properties (like scale).

params.name: coord
params.description: The amount of x and y coordinates we want the map to move. I.e. { x: 5, y: 0 }. With this we want the map to move horizontally 5 pixels and vertically stay at the same position.

params.name: informCoordinates
params.description: THIS IS EXPERIMENTAL, TO FIX THE INCORRECT EVENT COORDINATES THIS SEND TO mapEvents, WHEN SCALING

name: cacheMap
description:
Cache the map. This provides significant performance boost, when used correctly. cacheMap iterates through all the
layer on the map and caches the ones that return true from getCacheEnabled-method.

name: unCacheMap
description: unCache the map.

name: activatePlugins
description: Activate plugins for the map. Plugins need .pluginName property and .init-method

params.name: pluginsArray
params.description: Array that consists the plugin modules to be activated

name: activatePlugin
description: Activate plugins for the map. Plugins need .pluginName property and .init-method

params.name: plugin
params.description: Plugin module instance.

name: mapMoved
description: getter and setter for detecting if map is moved and setting the maps status as moved or not moved

params.name: yesOrNo
params.description: Has the map moved, or not.

params.name: isFinal
params.description: Is this the last time map has been moved with this event chain.

name: toggleFullsize
description:
Resize the canvas to fill the whole browser area. Uses this.eventCBs.fullsize as callback, so when you need to overwrite
the eventlistener callback use this.eventCBs

name: toggleFullScreen
description:
Toggles fullscreen mode. Uses this.eventCBs.fullscreen as callback, so when you need to overwrite
the eventlistener callback use this.eventCBs

name: getObjectsUnderPoint
description: Filter objects based on quadtree and then based on possible group provided

params.name: globalCoords
params.description: The global coordinates on canvas, that is hitTested.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the objects / layer to find.

return.description: Array of object found on the map.
{ x: Number, y: Number }, current coordinates for the moved map

name: core/mapEvents.js
core/Map_layers.js
constructor
description: Creates a basic layer for the Map. This type of layer can not hold subcontainers. Note that different devices and graphic cards can only have specific size of bitmap drawn, and PIXI cache always draws a bitmap thus the default is: 4096, based on this site: http://webglstats.com/ and MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE. This is important also when caching.

params.name: options
params.description: optional options

params.name: options.name
params.description: Layers name, used for identifying the layer. Useful in debugging, but can be used for finding correct layers too

params.name: options.coord
params.description: coord starting coords of layer. Relative to parent map layer.

params.name: options.specialLayer
params.description: Is this layer special (e.g. UILayer not included in normal operations)

name: name
description: Layers name, used for identifying the layer. Useful in debugging, but can be used for finding correct layers too

name: specialLayer
description: Is this layer special (e.g. UILayer not included in normal operations)

name: hasSubContainers
description: Does this layer use subcontainers.

name: getCurrentCache
description: Is this layer cached at the moment or not.

name: move
description: Move layer based on given amounts

params.name: coord
params.description: The amount of x and y coordinates we want the layer to move. I.e. { x: 5, y: 0 }. This would move the map 5 pixels horizontally and 0 pixels vertically

name: setScale
description: set layer scale

params.name: amount
params.description: The amount that you want the layer to scale.

return.description: The same amount that was given, except after transform to 2 decimals and type cast to Number

name: getScale
description: get layer scale

name: getUIObjects
description: get UIObjects on this layer, if there are any, or defaulty empty array if no UIObjects are active

name: emptyUIObjects
description: Remove all the UIObjects from this layer

name: addUIObjects
description: Add UIObjects to this layer

params.name: objects
params.description: Objects can be an object containing one object to add or an Array of objects to add.

return.description: All the UIObjects currently on this layer

name: getPrimaryLayers
description: Get primary layers, that this layer holds as children. So basically all children that are not special layers (such as UI layers etc.)

return.description: Primary children layers under this layer

name: getObjects
description: Get all objects that are this layers children or subcontainers children. Does not return layers, but the objects.

return.description: All the objects (not layers) found under this layer

params.name: status
params.description: true = activate cache, false = disable cache

name: constructor
description: Layer designed to hold subcontainers. But can handle objects too.

params.name: name
params.description:
layer property name, used for identifiying the layer, usefull in debugging, but used also
otherwise too!

params.name: coord
params.description:
starting coords of layer. Relative to parent map layer.

Different devices graphic cards can only have specific size of bitmap drawn, and PIXI cache always draws a bitmap
thus the default is: 4096, based on this site: http://webglstats.com/ and MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE

name: constructor
description:
Subcontainers are containers that hold objects like units and terrain etc. under them. They have some restrictions atm. since they are PIXI.ParticleContainers. But when needed we can extend Map_layers with another class which is subcontainer, but not ParticleContainer at the present there is no need, so we won't extend yet. Subcontainers help the layers to make better movement of the map, by making subcontainers visible or invisible and even helping with selecting objects on the map. Thus we don't need to use our inefficient Quadtree.

NOTICE! PIXI.ParticleContainer is much more strict than normal containers. When you encounter issues with it. Please check the restrictions on ParticleContainer.

params.name: size
params.description: Size of the subcontainer

name: getSubcontainerArea
description: Gets this subcontainers coordinates and size

params.name: scale
params.description: The size of scale the map currently has

params.name: options.toGlobal
params.description: Do we get the global coordinates or local

name: setCache
description: Set cache on or off for this layer

params.name: status
params.description: true = activate cache, false = disable cache

name: setCorrectSubContainer
description: [setCorrectSubContainer description]

params.name: displayObject
params.description: [description]

params.name: parentLayer
params.description: [description]

name: getClosestSubcontainers
description: Get the closest subcontainers of the given area.

params.name: layer
params.description: The layer being used

params.name: xIndex
params.description: x / horizontal index.

params.name: yIndex
params.description: y / vertical index.

name: core/map_validators.js
core/move/map_drag.js
core/ObjectManager.js
ObjectManager
description:
this module is responsible for doing hitTesting, like returning the units on certain clicked coordinates or
when objects or areas collide with each other.
It uses quadtree for preliminary filtering of matching objects and then the framework specific collision detection

params.name: hitDetector
params.description: Object or function that handles hit detection. This can be omitted in many cases

name: retrieve
description: Retrieve objects under certain coordinates or area, if size is given

types: { globalCoords: { x:Number, y:Number }, localCoords: { x:Number, y:Number } }
params.name: allCoords
params.description: the coordinates which we want to hitTest

params.name: type
params.description: type of the object / layer that we want to retrieve

params.name: options
params.description: optional options

params.name: options.subcontainers
params.description: The subcontainers we match against

params.name: options.size
params.description: Size of the rectangle area to match against, if we want to match rectangle instead of one point

name: addObject
description: Add object to hitDetection layer

params.name: type
params.description: type of the object / layer that we want to add

params.name: hitArea
params.description: area that is hitTested

params.name: obj
params.description: object that we want to store. If hitTest succeeds this object is returned.

name: addLayer
description:
Add hitDetection layer. Basically you create layers for different object types, like for example one for the
terrain, one for the units and one for the cities. The quadtree does not really require bounds, so we omit them.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of the layer that we want to add

params.name: bounds
params.description: Bounds for the quadtree layer

params.name: extra
params.description: quadtree-settings: maximum objects before we split and maximum levels of nested layers

name: core/Objects.js
constructor
description: The base class of all sprite objects

params.name: coords
params.description: the coordinate where the object is located at, relative to it's parent

params.name: data
params.description: objects data, that will be used in the game. It will not actually be mainly used in graphical but rather things  like unit-data and city-data presentations etc.

params.name: options.currFrame
params.description: currFrame the current frames number. This is basically the initial image, we can change it later for animation or such

name: name
description: Name of the object. Used mostly for debugging

name: type
description: Type of the object. Can be used for filtering, ordering or finding correct objects.

name: highlightable
description: Is the object highligtable.

name: selectable
description: Is the object selectable.

name: data
description: Objects custom data. Holds unit statistics and most data. Like unit movement speed etc.

name: currentFrame
description: Current frame (from spritesheet) we are showing.

name: areaWidth
description: Object area width in pixels.

name: areaHeight
description: Object area height in pixels.

name: innerDraw
description: Drawing the object

params.name: x
params.description: coordinate x

params.name: y
params.description: coordinate y

name: drawNewFrame
description: Draws new frame to animate or such

params.name: x
params.description: coordinate x

params.name: y
params.description: coordinate y

params.name: newFrame
params.description: New frame number to animate to

name: getGraphicalArea
description: Get the area that is reserved for the graphical presenation of this object as a rectangle.

params.name: options
params.description: toGlobal: Boolean. Should the method return global coordinates or local (movableLayer)

types: Object}               { x: Number, y: Number, width: Number, height: Number

name: localToLocal
description: Coordinate conversion: localToLocal

params.name: x
params.description: X coordinate

params.name: y
params.description: Y coordinate

params.name: target
params.description: The DisplayObject where we should target the coordinates for

name: clone

params.name: options
params.description: position: Boolean, anchor: Boolean

name: constructor
description:
Terrain tile like desert or mountain, non-movable and cacheable. Normally, but not necessarily, these are
inherited, depending on the map type. For example you might want to add some click area for these

params.name: coords
params.description: format: {x: Number, y: Number}. Coordinates for the object relative to it's parent

params.name: data
params.description: This units custom data

params.name: options
params.description: other specific options for constructing this terrain

name: constructor
description: Map unit like infantry or worker, usually something with actions or movable. Usually these are extended, depending on the map type. For example you might want to add some click area for these (e.g. hexagon)

params.name: coords
params.description: Coordinates for the object relative to it's parent

params.name: data
params.description: This units data

params.name: options
params.description: other specific options for constructing this unit, like options.throwShadow

name: actions
description: actions bound to this object. @todo THIS HAS NOT BEEN IMPLEMENTED YET!

name: doAction
description: Execute action on units (move, attack etc.). @todo THIS HAS NOT BEEN IMPLEMENTED YET!

name: addActionType
description: Add certain action type. @todo THIS HAS NOT BEEN IMPLEMENTED YET!

name: addCallbackToAction
description: Attach callback for the certain action type. @todo THIS HAS NOT BEEN IMPLEMENTED YET!
